intro: Memecylon garcinioides, commonly known as the Indian white wood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
